tit.cmt: 英語の説明を追加しました。

sen.j: 地方貨幣（ちほうかへい）とは、江戸時代に各藩により原則として領内通用として発行された貨幣であり、戦国時代 (日本)から江戸時代初期にかけて、各大名が自国領内通用として発行した金貨銀貨は特に領国貨幣（りょうごくかへい）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: Chiho Kahei is currency is issued principally to be used within the issuer's territory and was issued by various clans in the Edo period; particularly, gold and silver coins issued by various daimyo to be used within the territory during the time from the Sengoku period to the early Edo period is also called Ryogoku Kahei.

Chiho Kahei was a currency issued principally to be used within a territory and was issued by various domains in the Edo period, and particularly, gold and silver coins issued by various daimyo to be used within their territories from the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) to the early Edo period were also called Ryogoku Kahei.
sen.cmt: 時制の修正、「藩」をdomainに修正、「戦国時代」を指定の統一用語に修正、文法の修正（is をwereに）しました。
sen.e: Chiho Kahei was a currency issued principally to be used within a territory and was issued by various domains in the Edo period, and particularly, gold and silver coins issued by various daimyo to be used within their territories from the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) to the early Edo period were also called Ryogoku Kahei.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 江戸時代、徳川家康により整備の始められた慶長の幣制は、貨幣の全国統一をはかるものであり、本来地方貨幣は存在するべきものではない。
sen.e: The monetary system of Keicho era, to which Ieyasu TOKUGAWA embarked on in the Edo period, was aimed at create a monetary system applicable to whole country; therefore, by nature Chiho Kahei is not the currency whose existence is permitted; however, Ieyasu used Ryogoku Kahei issued by Shingen TAKED as a basis of 'ryo,' the monetary system of Koban in the early period of Edo period; for this reason he permitted issue of Koshukin with the condition that the gold coin is only to be used within the Kai Province; Koshukin inherits Ryogoku Kahei issued by Shingen TAKEDA.
Since the monetary system of the Keicho era, which was started by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA in the Edo period, was aimed at create a national monetary system, any local currencies should not exist.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました。冒頭Sinceを追加して不要なセミコロンを削除しました。冠詞の追加、関係代名詞の節を修正しました。
sen.e: Since the monetary system of the Keicho era, which was started by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA in the Edo period, was aimed at create a national monetary system, any local currencies should not exist.

sen.j: が、江戸時代前半には小判の通貨体系としての「両」の基となった、武田信玄による甲斐国の領国貨幣を引き継いだ甲州金に限り領内通用を条件に発行が認められた。
sen.e: However, Ieyasu used Ryogoku Kahei issued by Shingen TAKEDA as the basis of 'ryo,' the monetary system of koban (former Japanese oval gold coin) in the early period of Edo period, and for this reason, he permitted issue of Koshukin, a successor of the local currency established by Shingen TAKEDA, with the condition that the currency was only to be used within the Kai Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました。TAKEDAがTAKEDとなっていたので修正、セミコロンを削除し文章の構成を変更しました。
sen.e: However, Ieyasu used Ryogoku Kahei issued by Shingen TAKEDA as the basis of 'ryo,' the monetary system of koban (former Japanese oval gold coin) in the early period of Edo period, and for this reason, he permitted issue of Koshukin, a successor of the local currency established by Shingen TAKEDA, with the condition that the currency was only to be used within the Kai Province.

sen.j: 寛永通宝銭貨および鉄銭は、江戸の亀戸および京都の七条を中心として、全国各地の銭座で鋳造が行われたが、これらの大部分は江戸幕府の許可による公鋳銭で全国通用を目的とし、通常地方貨幣としては扱わない。
sen.e: Minting of Kanei Tuho Senka and Tessen was done in Zeniza (organization in charge of minting coins during the Edo period) of various regions centering on Kameido in Edo and shichijo in Kyoto; many of them are Kochusen (related to the TOKUGAWA Shogunate) and permitted by the Shogunate government and the aim is to be used in the whole country; therefore, these coins are not treated as Chiho Kahei or local currency.

Minting of Kanei Tuho coins and Tessen coins was done in Zeniza (organization in charge of minting coins during the Edo period) of various regions such as Kameido in Edo and Shichijo in Kyoto, and many of such coins were Kochusen, coins permitted by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), which were supposed to be used throughout the country, and therefore, these coins were usually not treated as a local currency.
sen.cmt: 地名の頭文字を大文字に、「江戸幕府」をthe Edo bakufuに、公鋳銭のあとのかっこ書きを削除、時制の修正しました。
sen.e: Minting of Kanei Tuho coins and Tessen coins was done in Zeniza (organization in charge of minting coins during the Edo period) of various regions such as Kameido in Edo and Shichijo in Kyoto, and many of such coins were Kochusen, coins permitted by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), which were supposed to be used throughout the country, and therefore, these coins were usually not treated as a local currency.

sen.j: また天明4年（1784年）に起こった天明の大飢饉を契機に領内救済を理由に、同年11月に仙台藩が幕府に鋳造を申し出、許可を取り付けた仙台通宝。
sen.e: When the Tenmei Famine occurred in Tenmei 4 (1784), Sendai Domain used this Famine as an opportunity and petitioned the Shogunate to grant a permission to mint Sendai Domain's own currency; the reason was to save his people in his territory and the domain received the permission; another example is Hakodate Tsuho; this minting of the coin was petitioned by Matsumae Domain and the petition was granted from the Shogunate at the time the port of Hakodate was about to open to the United States based on the Treaty between the United States of America and the Empire of Japan in November in 1856.

When the Tenmei Famine occurred in 1784, the Sendai Domain used this Famine as an opportunity and petitioned the bakufu to grant a permission to mint the Sendai Domain's own currency in order to save people in the domain's territory, and the domain received the permission to mint their own currency called Sendai Tsuho.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました。冠詞の追加、元号の削除、セミコロンの削除とそれに伴う語句の訂正しました。
sen.e: When the Tenmei Famine occurred in 1784, the Sendai Domain used this Famine as an opportunity and petitioned the bakufu to grant a permission to mint the Sendai Domain's own currency in order to save people in the domain's territory, and the domain received the permission to mint their own currency called Sendai Tsuho.

sen.j: これを始め安政3年（1856年）11月に日米和親条約に伴う開港を機に発行の許可を取り付けた箱館通宝が存在した。
sen.e: In addition, another example was Hakodate Tsuho, and the minting of this coin was approved when the port of Hakodate was about to open to the United States based on the Treaty of Peace and Amity between the United States of America and the Empire of Japan agreed in November in 1856.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました。
sen.e: In addition, another example was Hakodate Tsuho, and the minting of this coin was approved when the port of Hakodate was about to open to the United States based on the Treaty of Peace and Amity between the United States of America and the Empire of Japan agreed in November in 1856.

sen.j: さらに幕末の文久2年（1862年）、薩摩藩は琉球の救済を名目に、3年の年限つきで琉球通宝當百文 (通貨単位)銭の発行を申し出て許可されたが、これは藩財政の建て直し目的とした天保通宝密鋳の隠れ蓑とて用意周到に準備されたものであった。
sen.e: Furthermore, in 1862 toward the end of the Edo period, Satsuma Domain petitioned the Shogunate issuance of Ryukyu Tsuho Hyaku Mon (the currency unit) with the issue limit of 3 years with the reason to save Ryukyu and this petition was granted; however, this petition was carefully prepared by Satsuma Domain to cover-up minting of Tenpo Tsuho secretly; this minting of Tenpo Tsuho was aimed at to recover the Domain's weak finance.

Furthermore, at the end of the Edo period, in 1862, the Satsuma Domain petitioned the bakufu for the issuance of Ryukyu Tsuho Hyaku (hundred) Mon coins with an issue limit of 3 years in order to save Ryukyu and this petition was granted, but this petition was carefully prepared by the Satsuma Domain to secretly cover up minting of Tenpo Tsuho secretly to recover the Domain's weak finance.
sen.cmt: 冠詞の追加、余分な語句の削除（かっこ内の「通貨単位」はリンク先の用語）、セミコロンの削除とそれに伴う語句の修正しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, at the end of the Edo period, in 1862, the Satsuma Domain petitioned the bakufu for the issuance of Ryukyu Tsuho Hyaku (hundred) Mon coins with an issue limit of 3 years in order to save Ryukyu and this petition was granted, but this petition was carefully prepared by the Satsuma Domain to secretly cover up minting of Tenpo Tsuho secretly to recover the Domain's weak finance.

sen.j: 地方貨幣の発行は文久年間から幕末に集中しており、海防充実などの幕府事業の各藩への転化、一揆などの騒動対策による藩財政の逼迫、地方における銭貨の払底、藩札の信用低下による金属貨幣の発行、幕府の権力低下による各藩独立体制の進化、および朝廷による鋳銭宣下などが挙げられる。
sen.e: Currency issued by various domains are concentrated on the period from Bunkyu era to the end of the Edo period; the reasons lie in the following: the Shogunate government shifted the business of the government such as the naval defense to various domains; various domains faced with financial difficulties resulted from expenses for measures for riots; there were shortage of coins in provinces; metal currency became issued caused by the weakening of trustworthiness of Hansatsu (paper currency issued in various domains), various domains made a progress toward the independent system, Imperial proclamation of minting of coin was issue.

Most local currencies were issued between the Bunkyu era and the end of the Edo period, and its reasons were that the bakufu shifted governmental duties such as the naval defense to various domains, various domains faced with financial difficulties due to expenses for measures for riots, there was shortage of coins in provinces, metal currencies were issued due to the weakening of trustworthiness of Hansatsu (paper currency issued in various domains), various domains established an independent political system because the bakufu became less influential, and Imperial proclamation of minting of coin was issued.
sen.cmt: 冗長な語句の変更と文法上の誤りの訂正しました。
sen.e: Most local currencies were issued between the Bunkyu era and the end of the Edo period, and its reasons were that the bakufu shifted governmental duties such as the naval defense to various domains, various domains faced with financial difficulties due to expenses for measures for riots, there was shortage of coins in provinces, metal currencies were issued due to the weakening of trustworthiness of Hansatsu (paper currency issued in various domains), various domains established an independent political system because the bakufu became less influential, and Imperial proclamation of minting of coin was issued.

sen.j: 東北地方は度重なる冷害、飢饉にあえいだ一方で鉱山が多く金属資源は潤沢であったことから、幕末期に盛岡藩および久保田藩を中心に銀判および當百文銅銭および鉛銭など、数多くの貨幣が密鋳されたが、幕府には既にそれを取り締まる力はなかった。
sen.e: The people in Tohoku region had difficult time because they were attacked by the cold-weather and famine repeatedly; on the other hand, there were many mines in the region and metal resources were abundant; therefore at the end of the Edo period centering on Morioka Domain and Kubota Domain many coins of silver, copper, and lead were minted secretly without having a permission from the Shogunate as the Shogunate government no longer had the power to control these activities.

The Tohoku region suffered from cold-weather damage by the cold-weather and famine repeatedly, but on the other hand, there were many mines in the region and metal resources were abundant, so at the end of the Edo period, the Morioka Domain and the Kubota Domain secretly minted many coins of silver, copper, and lead without a permission from the bakufu because the bakufu no longer had enough power to control these activities.
sen.cmt: 冗長な語句の変更と文法上の誤りの訂正、不要なセミコロンの削除とそれに伴う語句の訂正しました。
sen.e: The Tohoku region suffered from cold-weather damage by the cold-weather and famine repeatedly, but on the other hand, there were many mines in the region and metal resources were abundant, so at the end of the Edo period, the Morioka Domain and the Kubota Domain secretly minted many coins of silver, copper, and lead without a permission from the bakufu because the bakufu no longer had enough power to control these activities.

sen.j: そればかりでなく、財政難にあえぐ各藩による二分金、一分銀、一朱銀および天保通寳などの密鋳が横行した。
sen.e: In addition, various domains aggressively minted coins such as 2 bu kin gold coin, 1 bu gin silver coin, 1 shu gin gold coin and the coin Tenpo Tuho secretly; particularly, the amount of secretly minted coin Tenpo Tsuho were so abundant that the total amount of Tenpo Tsuho came to occupied the one third to one fourth of the amount of Tenpo Tsuho circulated at that time.

In addition, various domains that had financial difficulties aggressively minted coins such as two-bu kin gold coin, one-bu gin silver coin, one-shu gin gold coin, and the currency called Tenpo Tuho secretly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました。数字はスペルアウト、冗長な語句の訂正しました。
sen.e: In addition, various domains that had financial difficulties aggressively minted coins such as two-bu kin gold coin, one-bu gin silver coin, one-shu gin gold coin, and the currency called Tenpo Tuho secretly.

sen.j: 特に天保通寳は密鋳によるものが流通高の約1/3～1/4を占めるに至った。
sen.e: In particular, the amount of secretly minted Tenpo Tsuho was so abundant that its amount came to occupy one-third to one-fourth of the total amount of Tenpo Tsuho circulated at that time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました。文法の誤りの訂正しました。
sen.e: In particular, the amount of secretly minted Tenpo Tsuho was so abundant that its amount came to occupy one-third to one-fourth of the total amount of Tenpo Tsuho circulated at that time.

sen.j: これらは鋳造による出目の幅が大きい名目貨幣であることが密鋳に拍車をかけ、銀台に金を鍍金したものや、亜鉛および鉛分を多く含む銀貨など悪質なものが多く見受けられる。
sen.e: These are nominal money of which the breadth of profit gained by minting is big; therefore, minting without officious permission further accelerated; those minted coins include many coins of inferior quality such as coin with plating of gold to the silver base and silver coin which contains much ink and lead and so on.

As these were nominal money of which the breadth of profit gained by minting was big, minting without official permission was accelerated, and those minted coins included many inferior quality coins such as silver coins with gold plating, silver coins which contained much ink and lead, and so on.
sen.cmt: 不要なセミコロンの削除とそれに伴う語句の訂正、時制の修正しました。
sen.e: As these were nominal money of which the breadth of profit gained by minting was big, minting without official permission was accelerated, and those minted coins included many inferior quality coins such as silver coins with gold plating, silver coins which contained much ink and lead, and so on.

sen.j: さらに寛永通寳についても公鋳銭を鋳写した鉄銭および鉛分を多く含む銅銭などが古くから密鋳され、彷鋳銭（ぼうちゅうせん）と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Furthermore, regarding Kanei Tsuho, the iron coin Tessen which is a copy of regular coin of Kanei Tsuho and copper coin with much lead and so forth have been made from ancient times; these coins are called Bouchusen.

Furthermore, regarding Kanei Tsuho, iron Tessen coins which were imitations of regular Kanei Tsuho coins and copper coins containing much lead were made for a long time, and these coins are called Bouchusen.
sen.cmt: 文法の誤りの訂正、不適切な語句の修正（ancient timesなど）しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, regarding Kanei Tsuho, iron Tessen coins which were imitations of regular Kanei Tsuho coins and copper coins containing much lead were made for a long time, and these coins are called Bouchusen.

sen.j: このような地方貨幣および彷鋳銭は密鋳故に古文書による記録史料が乏しい。
sen.e: There are not much historical materials with record on these local currencies and Bochusen among ancient documents; it is because these are secretly minted without permisiion from the Shogunate.
There are not many historical materials left with records on local currencies and Bochusen because they were minted secretly.
sen.cmt: 不要なセミコロンの削除とそれに伴う語句の訂正、時制の修正しました。
sen.e: There are not many historical materials left with records on local currencies and Bochusen because they were minted secretly.

sen.j: また、領国貨幣の中には後世による創作によると考えられる素性の不確かな物も存在し、そのような物も文化 (元号)7年（1810年）刊行の貨幣解説史料である『金銀図録』に掲載されている。
sen.e: In Ryogoku Kahei (currency used within daimyos' own territory), there exist currencies whose validity cannot be established; and make one think that that the currency in question might be created by someone in a later generation; such currency is also listed on "Kingin Zuroku" (A Record of Gold and Silver in Picture); this book was published in 1810 and including coins that are to be used as gift or for personal enjoyment and coins about which experts differ in their opinions, the book explains various gold and silver coins.

There are also some doubtful Ryogoku Kahei that are thought to have been created by someone in later generations, and such currencies are also listed on "Kingin Zuroku" (A Record of Gold and Silver in Picture), which was published in 1810.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処といたしました不要なセミコロンの削除とそれに伴う語句の修正
sen.e: There are also some doubtful Ryogoku Kahei that are thought to have been created by someone in later generations, and such currencies are also listed on "Kingin Zuroku" (A Record of Gold and Silver in Picture), which was published in 1810.

sen.j: 玩賞品（がんしょうひん）として扱われるものや、専門家の間でも議論の分かれる物も存在する。
sen.e: Some of such coins are used as a gift or for personal enjoyment and there are some coins that experts differ in their opinions.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処といたしました
sen.e: Some of such coins are used as a gift or for personal enjoyment and there are some coins that experts differ in their opinions.

sen.j: また、仙台小槌銀および合津銀判などは通貨としては手の込んだつくりであり、質量および額面は一般の通貨との整合性が見られないことから、流通目的というよりは祝鋳銭の部類と考えられている。
sen.e: Sendai Kozuchigin and Aizu Ginban and such are elaborate in their design as a currency; as there is no consistency between a general currency and the mass and the face value of these silver coins, these coins are thought to belong to Shukuchusen (coin to celebrate) rather than for circulation.Furthermore, currency such as Isawa Kaichin, Kaetsuno Tuyo, Ashu Tuho, and Tosa Kanken stayed in the phase of currency minted for trial; existing ones are rare and they are easily counted and the trace of circulation is not confirmed at all.Tosa Domain minted Tenho Tuho secretly without permission on a large scale; the trial minting should be regarded as camouflage of the secret minting.The reginal currencies thought to be circulated widely are just Sendai Tuho, Hakodate Tuho, Akita Tubasen, Akita Namisen, and Ryukyu Tuho.The paper currency used inside various domains and Hatamoto Satsu (paper currency used by the direct retainers of the Shogunate) are also belong to the regional currency; these currencies are widely circulated; especially Ginsatsu took an initiative for silver transaction by weight by acting as a substitute of silver coin whose value is determined by weight such as Chogin; these coins were decreased in circulation in the later period of Edo period. The main Chiho Kahei (Local Currencies) minted in the Edo period

Sendai Kozuchigin and Aizu Ginban are elaborate in their designs as a currency, and as there is no consistency in weight and nominal value with those of a general currency these coins are thought to have been used as Shukuchusen (coins to celebrate) rather than for circulation.
sen.cmt: 他の原文の訳文と混合されていますので分離しました。不要なセミコロンを削除しました。不適切な動詞を変更しました。
sen.e: Sendai Kozuchigin and Aizu Ginban are elaborate in their designs as a currency, and as there is no consistency in weight and nominal value with those of a general currency these coins are thought to have been used as Shukuchusen (coins to celebrate) rather than for circulation.

sen.j: さらに、膽澤開珎、加越能通用、阿州通宝および土佐官券の類は試鋳貨幣にとどまり現存も数品を数える様な稀少なものがほとんどであり、流通した形跡は全く確認されていない。
sen.e: Furthermore, currency such as Isawa Kaichin, Kaetsuno Tuyo, Ashu Tuho, and Tosa Kanken stayed in the phase of currency minted for trial; existing ones are rare and they are easily counted and the trace of circulation is not confirmed at all.

Furthermore, currencies such as Isawa Kaichin, Kaetsuno Tuyo, Ashu Tuho, and Tosa Kanken stayed in the trial phase of currency minting, and there are few actual coins left without any evidence of actual use.
sen.cmt: 後半は全体的に書き換えました。
sen.e: Furthermore, currencies such as Isawa Kaichin, Kaetsuno Tuyo, Ashu Tuho, and Tosa Kanken stayed in the trial phase of currency minting, and there are few actual coins left without any evidence of actual use.

sen.j: 土佐藩は寧ろ天保通寳の密鋳を大々的に行い、試鋳はそのカモフラージュと考えられるべきものである。
sen.e: Tosa Domain minted Tenho Tuho secretly without permission on a large scale; the trial minting should be regarded as camouflage of the secret minting.
The Tosa Domain minted Tenho Tuho secretly without permission on a large scale, and the trial minting should be regarded as camouflage of their secret minting
sen.cmt: 冠詞の追加、theをtheirに変更しました。
sen.e: The Tosa Domain minted Tenho Tuho secretly without permission on a large scale, and the trial minting should be regarded as camouflage of their secret minting

sen.j: 地方貨幣で広く流通したと考えられるのは仙臺通寳、箱館通寳、秋田鍔銭、秋田波銭および琉球通寳ぐらいのものである。
sen.e: The reginal currencies thought to be circulated widely are just Sendai Tuho, Hakodate Tuho, Akita Tubasen, Akita Namisen, and Ryukyu Tuho.
Reginal currencies that are thought to have been widely circulated are just Sendai Tuho, Hakodate Tuho, Akita Tubasen, Akita Namisen, and Ryukyu Tuho.
sen.cmt: 冠詞の修正、時制の修正しました。
sen.e: Reginal currencies that are thought to have been widely circulated are just Sendai Tuho, Hakodate Tuho, Akita Tubasen, Akita Namisen, and Ryukyu Tuho.

sen.j: また藩札および旗本札なども地方貨幣の部類に入るものである。
sen.e: The paper currency used inside various domains and Hatamoto Satsu (paper currency used by the direct retainers of the Shogunate) are also belong to the regional currency; these currencies are widely circulated; especially Ginsatsu took an initiative for silver transaction by weight by acting as a substitute of silver coin whose value is determined by weight such as Chogin; these coins were decreased in circulation in the later period of Edo period.
Paper currencies used in various domains and Hatamoto-satsu (paper currency used by direct retainers of the Shogunate) are also regarded as local currencies.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました冠詞の削除、単数形を複数形に、動詞の変更しました。
sen.e: Paper currencies used in various domains and Hatamoto-satsu (paper currency used by direct retainers of the Shogunate) are also regarded as local currencies.

sen.j: これらは広く流通し特に銀札は江戸時代後期に流通高が減少した丁銀などの秤量銀貨の代役を務め、銀目取引の主導権を握った。
sen.e: These currencies were widely circulated, and in particular, Ginsatsu took an initiative for silver transaction by weight by acting as a substitute of silver coins whose value was determined by weight such as Chogin, which were decreased in circulation in the later Edo period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました不要なセミコロンの削除とそれに伴う語句の変更しました。
sen.e: These currencies were widely circulated, and in particular, Ginsatsu took an initiative for silver transaction by weight by acting as a substitute of silver coins whose value was determined by weight such as Chogin, which were decreased in circulation in the later Edo period.

sen.j: 江戸時代に鋳造された主な地方貨幣
sen.e: The main Chiho Kahei (Local Currencies) minted in the Edo period
Major Chiho Kahei (Local Currencies) Minted during the Edo Period
sen.cmt: パラグラフ名なので各単語の頭文字を大文字に、冠詞の削除、mainをmajorにしました。
sen.e: Major Chiho Kahei (Local Currencies) Minted during the Edo Period
